questions.text: Author Stephen King paid for a professional-quality Little League baseball diamond behind his house in Bangor, ME. What is the nickname that the locals call it?
How many counties are there in Maine?
options: none - it is not divided into counties

questions.text: What is the capital of Maine?
questions.explanation:
Augusta.

	Augusta, ME and Juneau, AK are the only state capitals with names of months in them.

questions.text: What is the only interstate highway in Maine (not counting 3-digit extensions)?
questions.explanation:
I-95.

	I-95 runs from Miami, FL, to the US-Canadian border near Houlton, ME.

questions.text: Who is the only vice president whose official residence was Maine?
questions.explanation:
Hannibal Hamlin.

	Nelson Rockefeller, although born in Bar Harbor, ME, was a resident of New York when he was appointed vice president. "Harry Hamlin was an actor on 'LA Law'. Hannibal Lecter was the psycho in 'Silence of the Lambs'. David Getchell is my father-in-law.

questions.text: What is the only state that borders Maine?
questions.explanation:
New Hampshire.

	Only Alaska and Hawaii border fewer states - none.

questions.text: What is the largest city in Maine?
Which of the following is NOT a town in Maine?
Local dialect: what is a dooryard?
questions.correct: Area of one's property nearest the door
options: a scrapyard that recycles doors and other fixtures from old houses
a shipyard (door to the outside markets)
questions.explanation:
Area of one's property nearest the door.

	If your mom told you to play outside but not to leave the dooryard, you'd better know what it means.
